title: Drawing, "Sketches for an altar mensa"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash, red ink
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Top left: An angel, holding boughs of a tree which support four burning candles, sits beside a tabernacle, the left part of which is shown. It has the shape of a pavilion and Christ is sketched upon the door. Bottom: The left upper part of the mensa is shown with a ledge ending at right at the tabernacle in the shape of a pavilion.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sketches for an altar mensa".
Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash, red ink. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-492.
